overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a methodical approach to forecasting hourly time-series data with limited historical points (96 hours). The analyst identifies daily seasonality and an anomalous day, leading to the adoption of a robust median-based heuristic method that excludes the anomaly. The approach is pragmatic given data constraints, though it sacrifices statistical sophistication for simplicity and robustness.
key_insights: Exclusion of anomalous days improves forecast robustness
Median-based aggregation per hour mitigates outlier influence
Limited data (4 days) necessitates simplified methods over complex models
Explicit handling of missing values is avoided when historical data is complete
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex: Combines statistical pattern recognition with practical simplifications due to data constraints, featuring multi-step analysis but avoiding advanced modeling.
